description: Momi Fir (Abies Firma) is an incredible coniferous tree native to Japan that grows best in cool, moist climates. It is an evergreen conifer, meaning it has beautifully soft needles that don't fall off each winter and offer a cozy, wintery feel to any garden. The Momi Fir can reach heights of up to 45 feet, and with its dense, compact shape, it provides a wonderful privacy and wind-protectant barrier for any home. Its bark is mottled silvery-gray and its needles range from a dark blue-green to silvery-blue. It is a great option for container gardens, as it is relatively slow growing and can be pruned to maintain size and shape. Its beauty, hardiness, and adaptability make the Momi Fir an amazing ornamental tree.
